title: Universal Semantic Embeddings of Chemical Elements for Enhanced Materials Inference and Discovery
author: Yunze Jia (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Yuehui Xian (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Yangyang Xu (MOE Key Laboratory for Nonequilibrium Synthesis and Modulation of Condensed Matter, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Pengfei Dang (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Xiangdong Ding (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Jun Sun (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University), Yumei Zhou (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University), ..., Dezhen Xue (State Key Laboratory for Mechanical Behavior of Materials, Xi'an Jiaotong University)
relevance_why: The application of natural language processing models like ElementBERT can provide advanced elemental descriptors, which may inspire novel approaches in audio data processing, such as latent diffusion modeling.
background: Developing universal semantic embeddings for chemical elements to enhance prediction accuracy in materials discovery through natural language processing.
contribution: This paper introduces ElementBERT to solve the challenge of capturing nuanced chemical relationships, achieving up to 23% improvement in predictive accuracy on various alloy systems.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily utilized traditional empirical descriptors, which often lack comprehensive representation of complex material properties.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work significantly improves the representation by employing a BERT-based model trained on extensive alloy literature to generate richer contextual embeddings.

key_innovation: ElementBERT integrates knowledge from scientific literature to create semantic embeddings that comprehensively encode elemental relationships, improving predictive tasks.
real_world_impact: The framework enhances material discovery, potentially accelerating the development of advanced materials in industries such as aerospace and electronics.

new_terms.ElementBERT: **ElementBERT** is a domain-specific natural language processing model designed to generate semantic embeddings for elements based on alloy literature, improving material property prediction.
